comments.commentBody:
#27: That would be the amendment to the 1977 Commumity Reinvestment Act courtesy of Jimmy Carter and doubled down by Clinton via Andrew Cuomo, as HUD Secretary, and AG Janet Reno.

The Dems threatened banks not to "red line", even if it only appeared that banks were not lending to minorities, and told banks to go against bank lending rules.

Personally, I don't think any plan that calls for a 9% sales tax will every get legs (local sales taxes in Cook County, Illinois, are already nearly 10%), but I can see why he's leading.  He's the only one who has spoken of a plan.  The others are building platforms on criticizing the President or anyone who has a plan, with no substance.

I think this is a really great article and very pertinent. However, it is very incomplete and therefore potentially harmful. My one major concern is that if the USA stops buying Tomatoes, sugar etc... These people will end up without jobs in an even worse situation than there already terrible conditions. Are there companies or governments that treat their workers well that we could shift our dollar vote to?

Herman Cain is very closely aligned with the Koch brothers, and his tax plan is a reflection of of their philosophy which is to reward the rich, punish the poor and in general abolsih government as we know it particularly state governments.

Home Depot will survive...Mitt Romney will be in the White House...and the country will survive the Obama era of self-destruction...a malaise that Americans have suffered with for the past 3 years, under a radical unpredictable man in the White House.

There are not many followers left of the Obama phenomenon...Paulie of Boston...there will be, again, a sunny morning in America.

It was a Republican President (Nixon) who introduced General Revenue Sharing - a program that transferred federal tax dollars to states and cities as a counter-cyclical measure to prop up demand and pay for the increased need for local services that comes with a recession, while leaving it up to the localities to decide the best way to use those funds.   That's exactly what beleaguerd cities (who have already slashed budgets and exacted concessions from unions) need today.

So, obviously from my screen name, I am a professor. I teach at a community college. I run a classroom that encourages significant participation by all students throughout the class - the give and take in the discussion is beneficial for all. BUT there is a limit.

My school's disability office provides VERY limited accommodations for disabled students (mostly double time on exams). So I'm out there on my own (as I suspect this instructor was) trying to do right by my individual students and my class as a collective whole. When I have a schizophrenic student, who literally cannot agree on observed reality in a science class... I'm going to have to ask him not to contribute to the discussion. When I have a kid with undiagnosed ADHD who cannot resist speaking, often on unrelated tangents... I'm going to set strong and specific limits (one comment/question per 50 minute period, no more than 2 minutes speaking per time - that's a fair allotment in a class of 25-ish students). In this instance, I might well have set a limit, but, as with all of these types of instances, offered the option for followup in office hours, which are practically unlimited. I use a lot of technology too - if the stuttering presented such a problem, I also might have offered some form of accommodation using writing technologies.

Depending on the details, I too might have communicated my suggested strategies and limits in writing via email. Sometimes you just can't grab that kid after class, or you're running off to a meeting. Sometimes email is the only option - it may not even have been the first communication on the topic. People who have never taught have no idea how hard this stuff is.

I'm pretty horrified that this part-time instructor with no job security and an extensive positive evaluation record has been publicly vilified with no possibility for her own self-defense.

#12 "All they really want is a life"

So do I, and, I suspect, you. Once you open the borders to all, our dwindling wealth will be diluted, so that neither you nor I will have what we consider "a life." Please note that the Europeans you give as an example are fighting illegals off like crazy!

Yes, the fence and border patrol are a huge waste, not because they aren't doing a good job, but because our gov and White House most of all aren't doing their job.

Yes, it is feasible to secure the border from both terrorists, drug traffickers, and common criminals. And that can be done MUCH cheaper than we do. Just learn from Koreans, or from old Chinese and Russian ways of the communist era.

They use/d cost-effective tools: liberal use of attack dogs, shooting to kill, once caught trespassers won't see the light of day for decades if ever. Worked and works wonders. Not 100% proof but would definitely solve the problem and save $blns. Good will is all that's lacking.

It is just too convenient for some to blame all "bad" things on illegal immigration from south of the border. Fact is: we need a lot of immigrants from Latin America to do our farm labor, legal or not.  See the recent article about US farmers hoping to hire unemployed US citizens for the harvest and of the handful that showed up, most quit because it was "hard work."  As for securing the border, I'm yet to hear of one terrorist who came in from Mexico. And as for drugs? We're growing pot at home. Those among us who simply don't like darker-skinned people for whatever reason should have the courage to say so. And good luck to you.

deedycoghlan, as spouse of a BP agent who also lives a few miles from the border, I think that you underestimate the fact that om having your sense of security comes from having such a strong BP presence. I can't speak for where you live, but I know for a fact that the local news covers maybe 5% of what the agents achieve in protecting the borders. You might think it isn't worth spending money on multiple agents catching what you call "a single fence jumper." Do you have any idea these mere "fence jumpers" are sex offenders that have been deported? How many have been convicted of violent crimes in this country and are trying to merely "jump over the fence?" It is disheartening to live in border towns where families of these hard working agents have to hear about how needless the services of these agents is. However, I can only imagine how many like yourself might change their tune once the presence was limited and you had to endure the negative ramifications of it.

If congress will pass Lamar Smith's national E-Verify bill #2885, there will eventually be millions of self-deportations of illegal immigrants who can no longer use false I.D.'s to find work...with the only alternative being to TBS (Turn Back South) to their homeland - and maybe reentering the U.S. legally some day. National E-Verify is the perfect complimentary legislation for the enhanced border enforcement that has taken place in recent years...to send a message to the world that America steadfastly adheres to the rule-of-law.

Judy,

We see so many games plod along (see Jet offense most of last year), until crunch time then suddenly come alive in a flurry of offense, risk taking and big plays - what drives this transformation? Are the coaches inherently conservative until they have to open up? Is it really the grand chess match until inches become yards (yes, that Any Given Sunday reference) or the ball bounces one way or another?
What's sad is that while I find it perfectly credible that Iran would attempt such a thing, I have also come to believe that indeed, we and/or Israel might also have fabricated it.

It's NOT an either/or, as ONLY New Yorkers would provincially have it!   Even Parisians (and I am one) would understand.  I love NYC and lived there for 17 years, but California is much more vibrant artistically, though so much more spread out in a way NY (a wonderful town) cannot comprehend:  Los Angeles is a REGION: MOLA (Latin American Art), MOCA, LACMA (with 2 new amazing wings), Bergamont Station, Pasadena (Norton-Simon/Huntington), Brewery Art Walk, San Pedro, Palos Verdes, Laguna -- you name it.   NYC (as with Broadway) has to import its talent, after it has 'arrived' elsewhere.  Art in in the streets, here, and in the museums.  It's everywhere.

comments.commentTitle: NY Times Why not switch to a star rating? E.g. 5 stars excellent 1 star not so good.
comments.commentBody: Often reviewers who write very good or excellent reviews for the movies on this site, end up rating the same move a 1.  Some even admit the mistake in the review they write after rating the movie.

comments.commentTitle: Dear M. Scott - re: The Iron Lady as Anti-Muse
comments.commentBody: Dear M. Scott  - - Just re-read "The Iron Lady as Anti-Muse," then revisited "Black Boys on Mopeds" by Sinead O'Connor - highly recommend another listen!  Best Wishes!
Mostly it's a gorgeous tribute to the Alaskan wilderness beauty. But it's also a heartwarming story of a wolf dog, White Fang, who befriends a young man.  It's great.  See it.

Stem cells are stimulated by vigorous exercise. Circulation and oxygen uptake increases, metabolism increases, endorphins are produced.

"In one study from 2008, rats forced to run wound up with significantly more new brain cells after eight weeks than those who ran when they chose . . . ."

This could be the stem cell response to effective exercise. Evolution designed in stem cell building of tissues stressed by exercise.

Of course some other mechanism is also at work if you see immediate improvement in neuropathy within days. Endorphins are neurotransmitters, and exercise intensity above the comfort level for long duration releases endorphins.

"A publicized effect of endorphin production is the so-called "runner's high", which is said to occur when strenuous exercise takes a person over a threshold that activates endorphin production. Endorphins are released during long, continuous workouts, when the level of intensity is between moderate and high, and breathing is difficult." http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Endorphin

Perhaps endorphins account for the immediate improvement.

Exercise is good - on many levels.
This is just another good reason to make our streets and roads safe for bicycling, walking and running by young and old. People should not have to wait for RAGBRAI and only ride once a year, but be able to ride every day. As noted above, Parkinsons sufferers have been found to be able to ride bicycles, even when they have trouble walking. Safe and interesting place to ride to are needed.

Using a bike for transportation as well as recreation - work, shopping, visiting - lets you ride more frequently and consistently.
The Complete Streets program is targeted to making streets safer for non-motorized travel as well as for drivers. We can't keep on "improving" the streets and roads just for moving more cars faster. We need to really improve them for all users - and maybe we will have less sickness to treat all around.

'One result of the deal could be a more confrontational, Hamas-imbued Palestinian movement that could...pose a challenge to the Palestinian Authority in the West Bank.'

That helps to explain why Israel made the deal, doesn't it?

To Steve #4 '1,000 Palestinians for 1 Israeli ??? I assume there is no way Israel lets out any really dangerous prisoners, who have committed terrible crimes. '

As a rule, such prisoners don't make it to prison in the first place. Look up 'Bus 300.' That wasn't an isolated incident.

To Poster #1, Mayor in Florida, just so you know, there are no real drugs for ALS either. As the wife and caregiver of an ALS patient, and the daughter-in-law of woman who has had Parkinson's for 10 years (his mother,) I am living the ravages of serious terminal illness all around me. Although you might not agree, I would rather my husband had Parkinson's. At least we'd have had more time to eat a meal together, have a conversation that isn't with a letter board, or still be invited to a friend's house that doesn't have a wheelchair access.

And before you knock this doctor, who was raising money for Parkinson's research when he observed this effect, you should be thankful that he took his observations to the lab. There are clues in these quirks about the disease process. Something a pharmaceutical company would never "happen upon". Because it belongs in the category of Basic Research, which also helps all diseases universally. Unfortunately the handful of saintly neurologists who "see" (there is no treatment) ALS patients have so little time to offer their patients mostly because ALS patients go broke and have to use Medicaid and the hospital MBAs don't want them to waste their time on poor patients, that what the neurologist/clinicians can report to the poorly funded ALS researchers is minimal.

Yes, we are a first world nation, but I think with a terminal illness like ALS or Parkinson's we might as well be Greece. It's down to hoping the saints will want to dedicate their education, experience,intellectual curiosity and time to helping us.

In response for those calling for a "one state" solution (# 29 and 65), it is called Israel and has already existed for 63 years for both its Arab and Jewish citizens. It was built by the Fedayeen, the P.L.O., Yasser Arafat, the 1972 Munich massacre of Israeli Olympic athletes, the 1976 Air France hijacking to Entebbe Uganda and numerous Hamas suicide bombings of Israeli restaurants and buses. It was further built by the 1967 Khartoum Conference adoption of the "Three No's (No negotiation, No recognition, No peace, with Israel)" the P.L.O. "10 Point Program," calling for the eradication of Israel and Articles 7, 13 and 32 of the Hamas Charter calling for genocide against all Jews (not just Israelis), rejecting all forms of non-violent conflict resolution and calling any Palestinians who would negotiate peace traitors to the Palestinian cause, respectively. Add to that the Abbas refusal to negotiate for the 10 months while Israel did enact a settlement "freeze." That same process has built Gaza into an "open air prison," since the Hamas 2007 coup and the continued rocket and mortar attacks against southern Israeli towns.

As long as the conflict remains a "one to the exclusion of the other" proposition, the refusal to recognize the right of Israel to exist has resulted in a perverse form of "blowback," creating Israel as the "one state." As the concept of "trading land for peace" has been rejected by both Palestinian factions, they have forfeited land with their rejection of peace. To paraphrase another commentator, "the world is less interested in the suffering of a people failing to do their own nation building over 60 years." "The Palestinians have for decades been the goats of self-serving extremists. If they want their own country, they must find rational pragmatic leaders, able to galvanize a majority,"

If Hamas turns the release of Shalit into heightened belligerency and intransigence, they will regret it when Israel drops its previous restraint.

This is the goofiest, sorriest, most God-awful deal I have ever seen.  This does not help support the fight against terrorism.  This is a indirect effort by both Hamas and Israel's current conservative administration to sideline the only competent leaders of Palestine, Salaam Fayad and Mahmoud Abbas.  With Hamas taking center-stage as the "legitimate" leader of the Palestinian people, terrorist attacks will increase, and the settlers will gain even more of a moral imperative to steal land

Thank you, Mr. Kameny. I feel somewhat ashamed I didn't know your name or your existance until today. And to all the folks over 50 in our camp (dear god I feel bad about that pun. Its so incredibly lame. I hate puns and yet I cant stop. Ever.); Im only 25, and I say this to let you know the spirit continues in my generation.

But I feel this is also a place to make a point. Theres no such thing as gay rights. Never has been. Theres only Human Rights. And until all of us are treated with the dignity and respect we all deserve, none of us can be safe. If all it takes is a temporary majority in a single instance of time to outlaw a group, then ANY group can face such an outlaw.

This cannot be allowed to occur. We need to move away from hyperspecialized ideas of rights and work together, for all the rights every human is entitled to. If we dont, we will be picked off one by one.
